sen.j: 日野西家（ひのにしけ）は、名家 (公家)の家格を有する公家。
sen.e: Hinonishi family was a kuge (court noble) with kakaku (family status) of meike (the fourth highest family status for court nobles).
The Hinonishi family were kuge (court nobles) with kakaku (family status) of meike (the fourth highest family status for court nobles).
The Hinonishi family were kuge (court nobles) with kakaku (family status) of meike (the fourth highest family status for court nobles).

sen.j: 藤原北家日野流、広橋家支流。
sen.e: Branch line of the Hirohashi family of the Hino line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan
They are Branch of the Hirohashi family under the Hino line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan
They are branch of the Hirohashi family under the Hino line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
Its family crest is tsuru no maru (a crane in a circle).
Their family crest was tsuru no maru (a crane in a circle).
Their kamon (family crest) was tsuru no maru (a crane in a circle).
Karoku (hereditary stipend) in the Edo Period was 200 koku (approx. 36.1 cubic meters).
Their Karoku (hereditary stipend) during the Edo Period was 200 koku (approx. 36.1 cubic meters).
Their Karoku (hereditary stipend) during the Edo period was 200 koku (approx. 36.1 cubic meters).
After Meiji Restoration, viscount.
After Meiji Restoration, they held the title of viscount.
After Meiji Restoration, they held the title of viscount.

sen.j: 南北朝時代 (日本)末期に日野時光の三男、准大臣日野西資国によって創設される。
sen.e: This family was founded by Sukekuni HINONISHI, Jun-daijin (Vice Minister), who was the third son of Tokimitsu HINO, at the end of the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.
This family was founded by Sukekuni HINONISHI, Jun-daijin (Vice Minister), the third son of Tokimitsu HINO, at the end of the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.
This family was founded by Sukekuni HINONISHI, Jun-daijin (Vice Minister), the third son of Tokimitsu HINO, at the end of the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).

sen.j: 日野西盛光、日野西資宗と続くが資宗の子、朝光が早世したため、中絶した。
sen.e: The family was succeeded by Morimitsu HINONISHI and Sukemune HINONISHI, but, as Tomomitsu, a son of Sukemune died young, this family was discontinued.
sen.cmt: 「日野西資宗」、「朝光」の正しい読みは不明です。
sen.e: The family was succeeded by Morimitsu HINONISHI and Sukemune HINONISHI, but, since Tomomitsu, a son of Sukemune died young, this family was discontinued.
The family was succeeded by Morimitsu HINONISHI and Sukemune HINONISHI, but, since Tomomitsu, a son of Sukemune died young, this family was discontinued.

sen.j: 江戸時代に広橋総光の三男、衛門府日野西総盛が日野西を称し、再興する。
sen.e: In the Edo Period, Fusamori HINONISHI, Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards), who was the third son of Fusamitsu HIROHASHI, reestablished the family naming as Hinonishi.
During the Edo Period, Fusamori HINONISHI, Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards), the third son of Fusamitsu HIROHASHI, reestablished the family as Hinonishi.
During the Edo period, Fusamori HINONISHI, Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards), the third son of Fusamitsu HIROHASHI, reestablished the family as Hinonishi.

sen.j: 1884年（明治17年）7月8日日野西光善は子爵に叙せられる。
sen.e: On July 8, 1884, the peerage of viscount was conferred on Mitsuyoshi HINONISHI.
On July 8, 1884, the peerage of viscount was conferred on Mitsuyoshi HINONISHI.
On July 8, 1884, the peerage of viscount was conferred on Mitsuyoshi HINONISHI.
